ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT: For the consecutive unimolecular type first order reactions:
ENGLISH.OPT1: The concentration of component A increases continuously with time.
ENGLISH.OPT2: The concentration of component R increases continuously with time.
ENGLISH.OPT3: The concentration of the component R decreases to a minimum and then increases continuously with time.
ENGLISH.OPT4: The concentration of the component S increases continuously with time.

ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT:
A first order chemical reactions proceeds (k = 1.5 sec–1) at initial concentration of 2 mol/m3 at temperature 25°C. The percentage conversion for this reaction is 36%. If the same first order reaction is carried out with an initial concentration of 4 mol/m3 then the fractional conversion will be ________.

[Rounded off to 2 decimal places]
Which of the following is an incorrect statement regarding temperature and pressure effects?
ENGLISH.OPT1: The thermodynamic equilibrium constant is unaffected by the pressure of the system or by the kinetics of the reaction.
ENGLISH.OPT2: The equilibrium concentration of materials and equilibrium conversion of reactants can be influenced by pressure or inerts.
ENGLISH.OPT3: For an increase in pressure in gas reactions, conversions rises when the number of moles increases with reaction and conversion drops when the number of moles decreases with reaction.
ENGLISH.OPT4: A decrease in inerts for all reactions acts in the way that an increase in pressure acts for gas reactions.

ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT:
When concentrated urea is stored, it slowly converts (elementary reaction) to biuret,

To study the rate of reaction a sample of urea with an initial concentration of 20 mol/lit. It is stored at 100°C and after t = 7 hr 40 min, 1 % has been converted. The rate constant ‘k’ is represented as m × 10–6 (lit/mol.min). Then the value of m will be ________. [Rounded of one decimal place]

Liquid reactant A as follows:

A feed of aqueous enters in an ideal MFR, decomposes and a mixture of A, R and S produced. For 90% conversion of A, the exit concentration of S and the time constant are
For an exothermic reaction, a change in temperature leads to change in

A homogeneous gas phase reaction 4A → B + 7S takes place in an isothermal plug flow reactor. The reaction rate is, –rA = k1CA with k1 = 0.17 s–1; feed concentration of A  (CA0 ) = 0.1 mol/m3. Feed flow rate FA0 = 0.17 mol/s. To achieve 50% conversion, the size of the reactor will be (in m3)

A liquid macro fluid reacts according to A → R as it flows through a vessel. The percentage conversion of A for the following flow pattern will be ________ (in %). [Rounded off to the nearest integer]

The catalytic gas phase reaction A → 4R is run at 3.2 atm and 117°C in a packed bed reactor (assume plug flow). For 35% conversion of A to R for feed of 1000 mol/hr of pure A, the amount of catalyst needed is (in kg) ________ [rounded off to nearest integer]. The rate equation is given as
Which of the following is/are represents the false statements?
ENGLISH.OPT1: Conversion predicted by segregation model and maximum mixedness model always lies between that calculated for PFR and CSTR for order of reaction n > 1.
ENGLISH.OPT2: Reactor system is unique to the RTD function.
ENGLISH.OPT3: RTD function is not enough to predict the conversion of first order reaction.
ENGLISH.OPT4: Segregation or maximum mixedness conditions do not effect the rate of first order reactions.

ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT: Milk is pasteurized, if it is heated to 63°C for 30 min, but if it is heated to 74°C it only needs 30 secs for the same result. What is the activation energy of this sterilization process?

The variation of rate with reactant concentration for a given reaction is shown below. If we have plug flow reactor, small mixed reactor and large mixed reactor, the correct ordering of units for the case of given figure for n > 1 should be
ENGLISH.OPT1: Small mixed, large mixed and plug flow reactor.
ENGLISH.OPT2: Large mixed, small mixed and plug flow reactor.
ENGLISH.OPT3: Small mixed, plug flow and large mixed reactor.
ENGLISH.OPT4: Plug flow, small mixed and large mixed reactor.

ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT: A series reaction occurs in a batch reactor. Both the rate constants are equal i.e. k1 = k2 and initial concentration of A is 5 mol/lit. The maximum concentration of R will be (in mol/lit) ________. [Rounded of to two decimal places]
The desired liquid phase reaction is accompanied by the side reaction from the stand point of favourable product distribution, the most desirable contacting scheme is
ENGLISH.OPT1: An ideal plug flow reactor with the main stream of D and E.
ENGLISH.OPT2: An ideal PFR with the main stream of D and side stream of E.
ENGLISH.OPT3: An ideal PFR with the main stream of E and side stream of D.
ENGLISH.OPT4: An ideal MFR with the main stream of D and E.

ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT:
The first order decomposition of A is run in an experimental MFR:

Determine role played by pore diffusion in these runs.

The reactor with a number of dividing baffles is to be used to run the reaction A → R, with –rA = 0.05 CA mol/lit min. A pulse tracer test gives the following output curve:

The value of mean residence time will be (in min) ________. [Rounded off to nearest integer]

A simple chemical reaction A → B is being carried out in two ideal CSTR connected in series as shown below. The volume of the first reactor is 1.5 times that of the second reactor. The temperature of the reactors is such that the rate constant in the first reactor is 1.5 times the rate constant in the second reactor. Then the order of the reaction will be ________. [Rounded off to one decimal place]
Which of the following is/are correct about Michaelis-Menten kinetics?
ENGLISH.OPT1: At high CA, the rate is independent of CA.
ENGLISH.OPT2: At low CA, rate is directly proportional to CA.
ENGLISH.OPT3: At low CA, the rate is first order with respect to CA.
ENGLISH.OPT4: At all CA, the rate is inversely proportional to CE0 (the enzyme concentration).

ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT: For the chemical reaction it was found that doubling the concentration of A doubles the rate of formation of D, doubling the concentration of B quadruples the rate of formation of D and doubling the concentration of C has no effect on the rate of formation of D. The order of the reaction is

For the liquid phase zero order reaction A → B, the fractional conversion of A in an ideal continuous stirred tank reactor is found to be 0.3 at a space velocity of 0.1 min–1. The fractional conversion for an ideal plug flow reactor will be ________ [rounded off to two decimal places] at a space velocity of 0.2 min–1. Assume that all the other operating conditions are the same for CSTR and PFR.

The first order reversible liquid reaction:

Takes place in a batch reactor. After 8 min, conversion of A is 33.3%, while equilibrium conversion is 66.7%. The rate equation for this reaction is
Which of the following is/are incorrect assumptions of Langmuir adsorption isotherm?
ENGLISH.OPT1: Only one molecule will be adsorbed on one active site.
ENGLISH.OPT2: All active sites are energetically uniform.
ENGLISH.OPT3: There is no interaction between adsorbed molecule.
ENGLISH.OPT4: It is applicable for high pressure.

ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT:
An irreversible aqueous phase reaction A + B → P is carried out in an adiabatic mixed flow reactor. A feed containing 4 kmol/m3 of each A and B enters the reactor at 8 m3/h. If the temperature of the exit stream is never to exceed 500 K, then the maximum feed inlet temperature allowed is (in °C) ________.

[Rounded off to the nearest integer]

A first order reaction is conducted in a CSTR. If under otherwise uniform conditions, the reactant concentration in the fluid entering the reactor is doubled, the fractional conversion of the reactant will
ENGLISH.OPT1: Increase by a factor of two
ENGLISH.OPT2: Decrease by a factor of two

ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT: An irreversible homogeneous liquid phase reaction A → B + C is carried out in two isothermal flow reactors of 50 litres capacity each operating at 60°C. Both the reactors are operated in series with feed rate 25 mol/min, feed concentration as 2 mol/lit and rate constant as 0.50 min–1. If both the reactors are ideal plug flow reactors, then the percentage exit conversion will be ________. [Rounded off to 2 decimal places]
For the reaction 2HCL the order of the reaction is

A CSTR is to be design in which an exothermic liquid phase first order reaction of type A → B is taking place. Reactor is provided with jacket in which coolant is flowing and heat is removed from reactor in order to maintain reactor temperature at 70°C. Consider the following data:

If rate of heat removed by jacket is 3.33 KW, magnitude of heat of reaction is (in KJ/mol) ________
[rounded off to 2 decimal places]

The reaction A → B, with –rA = k CA required 90% conversion. If k = 0.5 min–1, CA0 = 2 moles/lit and V0 = 4 lit/min. The ratio of volume of CSTR to the volume of PFR is ________. [Rounded off to 2 decimal places]

A second order liquid phase reaction A → B is taking place in MFR. The exit conversion is 50%.
The exit fractional conversion through a new MFR will be ________ which is 6 times larger than the original reactor.
